reports.title: name="Baldur's Gate 3" appid="1086940" target_framerate="30-39 FPS title="Optimized settings, 30 FPS"

data.game_display_settings:
#### General
- **Display Mode:** Fullscreen
- **Resolution:** 1280x800
- **VSync:** Disabled
- **Frame Rate Cap:** Off
- **AMD FSR 1.0:** Off
- **AMD FSR 2.2:** Quality

#### Quality
- **Model Quality:** High
- **Shadow Quality:** Low
- **Cloud Quality:** Low
- **Texture Quality:** Medium
- **Texture Filtering:** Trilinear
- **Instance Distance:** Low
- **Fog Quality:** Low
- **Detail Distance:** Low
- **Animation Level of Detail:** Low

#### Advanced
- **FidelityFX Sharpening:** Off
- **Anti-Aliasing:** None
- **Ambient Occlusion:** Off
- **Depth of Field:** None
- **God Rays:** Off
- **Bloom:** Off
- **Subsurface Scattering:** Off
- **Slow HDD Mode:** Off
- **Dynamic Crowds:** On
data.additional_notes: This setup provides a mostly stable 30 FPS, with minor dips in Act 3 and during cutscene transitions. FSR 2.2 (Quality) improves image clarity while maintaining performance. Battery drain ranges from 13W indoors to 20W outdoors, with occasional peaks. Act 3 remains the most demanding area, occasionally dropping to 22-27 FPS but remaining playable due to the turn-based nature of the game.

data.summary: Baldur's Gate 3 is the most impressive cRPG I've played, and while it has some performance issues...
